e4: I recommended changing to the new policy because, while it may lead to initial market confusion among some informed investors, ultimately it promotes transparency and integrity in financial reporting. This can bolster trust with a broader segment of investors who value honesty.
e5: An ethical reporting policy would be characterized by transparency and honesty. It should provide a true reflection of financial health, untainted by personal biases or motives to manipulate perception. The process should also ensure that all stakeholders, not just sophisticated investors, have access to the accurate information on which they can make informed decisions.
e6: Yes. I would ask follow-up questions like how we plan to address any potential short-term market reaction or investor unease stemming from switching to an accurate reporting system.
